Detailed Description

Interface between the class CellCollection and the class GlobalArray.

This class allows the use of the GlobalArray class from the CellCollection class. It provides with the methods needed to collect the local arrays in each cell of the colony and to build a global array that regroup all the local arrays. The local arrays are made to reference to a part of the global array.

pair< int, int > GlobalArrayInterface::getLocalChannelAndCellIndices ( int  i  )  const

Get the cell index k and local channel index j from the global channel index i.

Parameters:
i [in] global channel index.
Returns:
indexPair [out] pair (cell index, local channel index). The cell index k ranges from -1 to nCells-1. The index -1 refers to the milieu and the index range 0,...,nCells-1 refers to the cells.
See also:
CellCollection::applyReaction()

void GlobalArrayInterface::buildArrays ( CellCollection *  cellCollectionPtr  ) 

Construct the global arrays from the local ones.

Pass the list of local arrays to the GlobalArray member to build it.

See also:
GlobalArray Construct the global arrays from the local ones.

GlobalArray

  • Get the list of local arrays.

  • Build the global array and get the list of global array ranges.

  • Call the setReferencePropensities in each cell of the cell collection with reference targets given in the previous list of global array ranges.

void GlobalArrayInterface::getLocalArrayList ( CellCollection *  cellCollectionPtr  )  [private]

Get a list of all the local arrays in the cell collection that need to be register in the global arrays.

Writes the list in localArrayList_.

Member Data Documentation

GlobalArray<double> GlobalArrayInterface::globalPropensities_ [private]

Global array of the propensities.

It contains consecutively:

  • propensities array of the milieu.
  • propensities array of cells 0,...,nCells-1.
    • each cell array contains the propensities of internal reactions and cell-milieu reactions.

GlobalArray<int> GlobalArrayInterface::globalX_ [private]

Global array of the states x.

It contains consecutively:

  • state array of the milieu.
  • state array of cells 0,...,nCells-1.

list< LocalArrayTarget<double> > GlobalArrayInterface::localArrayListPropensities_ [private]

List of the local array targets (pointer+size).

This list is used to build the global array. The list form is just to keep a general way of communication with the GlobalArray class.

See also:
LocalArrayTarget

list< LocalArrayTarget<int> > GlobalArrayInterface::localArrayListX_ [private]
